definitions: To refuse to answer a question in court on the grounds that one might incriminate oneself, based on the Fifth Amendment to the US Constitution.
To refuse to answer a question, especially one that might be embarrassing or incriminating, even outside of a legal context.
examples: The witness decided to plead the fifth.
When asked about the missing cookies, she chose to plead the fifth.
He was advised by his lawyer to plead the fifth.
pastTenses: pleaded the fifth, pled the fifth
